ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] some questions again
ygData.msgSnippet: Ulf, Yes, it is now necessary to define a wall to do non-adiabatic reactor simulations. Sensitivity analysis is not yet implemented, but would be a welcome

Ulf,

Yes, it is now necessary to define a wall to do non-adiabatic reactor=
  
simulations.

Sensitivity analysis is not yet implemented, but would be =
a welcome  
addition. I was not aware of "cvodes" - if you want to try impl=
ementing  
it, that's great.

In the latest (unreleased) version, it is pos=
sible to do opposed-nozzle  
diffusion or premixed flames. I have been busy=
 with other things, and  
have not had time to finish up this code to relea=
se it (but it is  
already in the public CVS repository). I plan to finish =
it up this week.

Dave

wrote:

> Dear Prof. Goodwin,
>
> first of all, thanks for the Cantera-1.4 =
release - it is much more
> structured than the old ones. I=B4m using Cante=
ra mostly for research
> code development using plug-flow-reactors.
>
> My =
question is, if it is now necessary to define a wall for an
> reactor to se=
t the heat transfer to non-adiabatic values? If I use
> the "setHeatTransfe=
rCoeff()"-function for an reactor it doesn=B4t have
> any effect.
>
> Anoth=
er question is if you are planning to implement Sensitivity
> Analysis. The=
re is an Code "cvodes" from sundials which offers some

his direction. If you want I will try to implement

n and make some suggestions how you could make

>
> Third que=
stion: is it possible to construct flame between two

ke oppdif in CH*MKIN) from the one-dim class?
>

 and look forward to your answers.
>
> best regards
